If you haven’t already, check out our [contributing guidelines](https://github.com/Expensify/ReactNativeChat/blob/main/contributingGuides/CONTRIBUTING.md) for onboarding and email contributors@expensify.com to request to join our Slack channel!
___

**Version Number:** v9.3.11-24
**Reproducible in staging?:** Yes
**Reproducible in production?:** Yes
**If this was caught during regression testing, add the test name, ID and link from BrowserStack:** https://test-management.browserstack.com/projects/2219752/folder/27754595/test-cases/77992811
**Email or phone of affected tester (no customers):** expensify416+da2@gmail.com
**Issue reported by:** Applause Internal Team
**Bug source:** Regression TC Execution
**Device used:** iPhone 12/ iOS 18
**App Component:** Money Requests

## Action Performed:
Preconditions
* Owner invites an approver and member to a workspace 
* Change the workspace approver from owner to the invited approver
* Approver account has never rejected an expense before.
* Submitter has submitted at least 3 expenses to the Approver

1. Log in as an Approver who has never rejected an expense
2. Open a submitted expense report
3. Select an expense >  "More" menu > Select "Reject"

## Expected Result:
An educational panel (RHP) should appear explaining the difference between "Hold" and "Reject"

## Actual Result:
No educational modal is displayed

## Workaround:
Unknown

- [ ] Android: App
- [ ] Android: mWeb Chrome
- [x] iOS: App
- [ ] iOS: mWeb Safari
- [ ] iOS: mWeb Chrome
- [ ] Windows: Chrome
- [ ] MacOS: Chrome / Safari

**Issue reported by:** Applause Internal Team
**Bug source:** Pull Request QA execution
**Device used:** Windows 11, Chrome | iPhone SE 3rd generation, iOS 26.2.1
**App Component:** Other

## Action Performed:
Issue 1:
1. Go to https://staging.new.expensify.com/
2. Sign up with a Gmail address that includes a +
3. In 'What's your work email?' page, click Skip
4. Select 'Track and budget expenses'
5. Enter any name, click Continue
6. In 'Stay organized with a workspace' page, click Create workspace
7. Click on Inbox, navigate to Concierge, then click 'Set up categories' task

Issue 2:
1. Go to https://staging.new.expensify.com/
2. Sign up with a Gmail address that includes a +
3. In 'What's your work email?' page, click Skip
4. Select 'Manage my team's expenses' > 1-10 employees > QBD > Continue
5. Click on Inbox, navigate to Concierge, then click 'Invite your team' task

Issue 3:
1. Go to https://staging.new.expensify.com/
2. Sign up with a Gmail address that includes a +
3. In 'What's your work email?' page, click Skip
4. Select 'Manage my team's expenses' > 1-10 employees > None
5. In 'What features are you interested in?' select all features, then click Continue
6. Click on Inbox, navigate to Concierge, then click 'Set up tags' task (video is shown)
7. Return back to Concierge chat, open 'Set up categories' and 'Invite your team' tasks (video is shown).

## Expected Result:
No video should be shown in the task.

## Actual Result:
The old onboarding video is displayed in the 'Set up categories', 'Invite your team' and 'Set up tags' tasks.

## Workaround:
Unknown

title: [$250] [Performance] Attachments/images load extremely slowly when viewing in the app

labels.name: External
labels.description: Added to denote the issue can be worked on by a contributor

labels.name: Daily
labels.description: KSv2

labels.name: Help Wanted
labels.description: Apply this label when an issue is open to proposals by contributors

labels.name: Bug
labels.description: Something is broken. Auto assigns a BugZero manager.

labels.name: Hot Pick
labels.description: Ready for an engineer to pick up and run with

body:
## Problem Attachments and images load very slowly when viewing them in the app, with reports of nearly a minute to load a single low-resolution image even on fast internet connections. ### Observations - On mobile (iOS), loading a single attachment can take ~1 minute for a low-res image - Web loads faster than mobile, but still slower than expected for a responsive application - User's internet is fast and everything else loads fine - The issue is reproducible and was observed by multiple team members during Onshore ## Suspected Cause The attachment carousel feature may be preloading all images in the chat to enable the `<` and `>` navigation arrows. For chats with many attachments, this means: 1. Opening one image triggers loading of potentially dozens/hundreds of other images 2. This causes significant delays before the requested image is visible 3. Large/active chats are disproportionately affected ## Expected Behavior - The selected attachment should load within 1-2 seconds on a decent internet connection - If carousel preloading is needed, it should happen lazily/progressively after the primary image is loaded - Adjacent images (prev/next) could be prioritized over distant ones ## Reproduction Steps 1. Open a chat with many attachments/images 2. Tap on an attachment to view it in the full-screen viewer 3. Observe the loading spinner duration ## Platform - [x] iOS (primary report) - [ ] Android (needs verification) - [x] Web (also affected but less severe) ## Related Discussion Slack thread: https://expensify.slack.com/archives/C05LX9D6E07/p1770083248855669 ## Possible Solutions 1. **Lazy carousel loading**: Only preload adjacent images (N-1, N+1) initially, then progressively load others 2. **Show image immediately**: Display the requested image first, then load carousel images in background 3. **Thumbnail fallback**: Show low-res thumbnails for carousel navigation while full-res images load on demand 4. **Limit preload count**: Cap the number of images preloaded for the carousel

  • Last Price Increase: 2026-02-03

body:
If you haven’t already, check out our [contributing guidelines](https://github.com/Expensify/ReactNativeChat/blob/main/contributingGuides/CONTRIBUTING.md) for onboarding and email contributors@expensify.com to request to join our Slack channel! ___ **Version Number:** V9.3.11-17 **Reproducible in staging?:** Yes **Reproducible in production?:** N/A - new feature, doesn't exist in prod **If this was caught during regression testing, add the test name, ID and link from BrowserStack:** https://github.com/Expensify/App/pull/80915 **Email or phone of affected tester (no customers):** dreamnitethedragon+yydyd373@gmail.com **Issue reported by:** Applause Internal Team **Bug source:** Exploratory - Significant User Experience Deterioration **Device used:** Redminote 10S Android 13 **App Component:** Money Requests ## Action Performed: 1.Launch app 2. Create a workspace 3. Tap account - expense rule 4. Create a rule [merchant A - update merchant to Beep] 5. Create a expense with merchant Shahrukh 6. Note merchant updated to Beep doing partial match 7. Go to expense rule and create second rule [ If merchant Beep - update merchant to Zen] 8. Create a expense with merchant A 9. Note merchant updated to Zen [as sequence chain 2 rules applied] ## Expected Result: When creating expense with Merchant A , it must be updated to Beep. ## Actual Result: When creating expense with Merchant Shahrukh , it is updated to Beep doing partial match. When creating expense with Merchant A , it is updated to Zen (Expense rule applied sequentially). ## Workaround: Unknown ## Platforms: - [x] Android: App - [ ] Android: mWeb Chrome - [x] iOS: App - [ ] iOS: mWeb Safari - [ ] iOS: mWeb Chrome - [x] Windows: Chrome - [ ] MacOS: Chrome / Safari ## Screenshots/Videos https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/e7a99fe7-4e3e-49ea-adae-197d87c1c783 [View all open jobs on GitHub](https://github.com/Expensify/App/issues?q=is%3Aopen+is%3Aissue+label%3A%22Help+Wanted%22)

Create an expense report on a workspace that allows editing report title. 2. Open the report. 3. Tap More. ## Expected Result: You should see a `Title` button in `More`. Tapping it should open the existing page to edit report title. It'd only appear when the report title is editable. ## Actual Result: This isn't possible. We've received feedback from customers that this is challenging to find. ## Screenshots/Videos [View all open jobs on GitHub](https://github.com/Expensify/App/issues?q=is%3Aopen+is%3Aissue+label%3A%22Help+Wanted%22)

Go to https://staging.new.expensify.com/ 2. Click on FAB 3. Click on 'Create expense' 4. Click on 'Scan' 5. Upload a receipt 6. Change recipient to yourself (selfDM) 7. Click on 'Create expense' 8. Click on FAB 9. Click on QAB 10. Upload a receipt without specified currency ## Expected Result: Scanning a receipt without currency results in currency assignment based on location. ## Actual Result: Receipt scan without currency assigns incorrect currency based on location ## Workaround: Unknown ## Platforms: - [ ] Android: App - [ ] Android: mWeb Chrome - [ ] iOS: App - [ ] iOS: mWeb Safari - [ ] iOS: mWeb Chrome - [x] Windows: Chrome - [x] MacOS: Chrome / Safari ## Screenshots/Videos https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/a5e12c9b-ba2c-46b7-a5c8-259fe714c71a [View all open jobs on GitHub](https://github.com/Expensify/App/issues?q=is%3Aopen+is%3Aissue+label%3A%22Help+Wanted%22)

body:
If you haven’t already, check out our [contributing guidelines](https://github.com/Expensify/ReactNativeChat/blob/main/contributingGuides/CONTRIBUTING.md) for onboarding and email contributors@expensify.com to request to join our Slack channel! ___ **Version Number:** **Reproducible in staging?:** Needs Reproduction (Reproduction blocked , Requires Expensify card transactions) **Reproducible in production?:** Needs Reproduction **If this was caught during regression testing, add the test name, ID and link from BrowserStack:** **Email or phone of affected tester (no customers):** **Logs:** https://stackoverflow.com/c/expensify/questions/4856 **Expensify/Expensify Issue URL:** **Issue reported by:** **Slack conversation** (hyperlinked to channel name): #Expensify Bugs ## Action Performed: 1. Log in as a user with reviewer or approver permissions 2. Open an expense report submitted by another user (original cardholder) 3. Locate an expense on the report (e.g., an Expensify Card transaction) 4. While reviewing the report, select “New” to create a new report for the expense 5. Observe the newly created report and where the expense is moved ## Expected Result: The new report should be created under the original submitter/cardholder’s account, with the expense remaining on that user’s report. ## Actual Result: The new report is created under the reviewer’s account, and the expense is moved there. ## Workaround: Unknown ## Platforms: Select the officially supported platforms where the issue was reproduced: - [ ] Android: App - [ ] Android: mWeb Chrome - [ ] iOS: App - [ ] iOS: mWeb Safari - [ ] iOS: mWeb Chrome - [x] Windows: Chrome - [x] MacOS: Chrome / Safari ## Screenshots/Videos [View all open jobs on GitHub](https://github.com/Expensify/App/issues?q=is%3Aopen+is%3Aissue+label%3A%22Help+Wanted%22)

## Action Performed:
Prerequisite: Log in with  applausetester+...@applause.expensifail.com  Account has at least one workspace. Submission frequency set to "Instantly"

1. Open any workspace chat.
2. Turn off internet connection.
3. Create a manual expense.
4. Open the report of the just created expense.

## Expected Result:

## Actual Result:
Next step message displays "Waiting for your expenses to automatically submit". Submit button in header.

Unknown
